User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; sl; rv:1.9.2.14)

When I need to send an additional message to the same recipient before they have responded, I use reply to one of my sent messages, which retains the message references (for automatic thread-tracking), unfortunately this uses the sender address -- my own address, which is not only useless, but also causes me to send messages to myself now and again. :)

Please implement some sort of feature that would make Thunderbird use the recipient of the message instead of the sender when the sender is the same person who is replying.

By the way, Outlook seems to implement this already.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select a message in Sent
2. Reply


Actual Results:  
The message is addressed to me.

Expected Results:  
The message would be addressed to the recipient of the message.

This almost certainly means that Thunderbird isn't recognizing that the From address is one of your identities. If the from address shows up as "You" or "You <your@address.com>"*, then replying to an email will send to the To address. Otherwise, it sends to the From address.

* Assuming you have "Show only display names for people in my address book" selected

comments.text: As I recall, email addresses are technically case-sensitive according to the spec (well, the local-part is; the domain isn't). In practice, almost every server uses case-insensitive local-parts, though I'm not sure it's safe to assume that in general.
